title: Riven Tides Update
teaser: New ground. A major ARC presence. The season finale hits in April and it is bringing something big.
summary: Riven Tides is the fourth and final Escalation update, planned for April 2026. It is expected to feature a new or heavily reworked map, potentially coastal themed, and a significant new high-level ARC boss. This is the culmination of the Escalation season narrative arc.
howItWorks: New or heavily updated map expected
Major new ARC boss encounter
Culmination of Escalation season storyline
Full details not yet revealed
raiderImpact: Solo: Boss content historically requires squad play
Duo: May be viable depending on boss mechanics
Trio: Almost certainly the intended squad size for boss content

title: Flashpoint Update
teaser: Lightning on the horizon. New threats. The Scrappy might actually be useful after this one.
summary: Flashpoint is the third Escalation update, planned for March 2026. It introduces lightning hazards as a new environmental threat, additional enemy types, and meaningful improvements to the Scrappy companion. Details remain limited but the roadmap confirms it as a major content drop.
howItWorks: New lightning hazard environmental condition
Additional ARC enemy types
Scrappy companion improvements and new functionality
Expected to continue monthly Raider Deck cadence
raiderImpact: Solo: Lightning hazards add another survival variable to manage
Duo: Scrappy improvements may reduce the need for a third
Trio: New enemies likely scale to squad size

title: Second Expedition
teaser: The tunnels out of Speranza open again. Fresh start, new bonuses, but everything you built gets left behind. Choose wisely.
summary: The second Expedition is the seasonal character reset. Sign-ups open February 25 and departure is March 1. Stash value requirement for max rewards has been lowered to 3 million Coins (down from 5 million). Catch-up mechanic lets Raiders who missed first Expedition skill points recover them at a 50% discount.
howItWorks: Sign-up opens February 25, departure March 1
Stash value requirement lowered to 3M Coins for max 5 Skill Points
Catch-up mechanic: missed Skill Points from Expedition 1 available at 50% cost
Permanent: cosmetics, Raider Tokens, Trophy Display, Codex, Raider Deck progress
Reset: level, stash, inventory, loadouts, skill tree
Patchwork outfit evolves with new toggles and color options
Buffs stack for consecutive departures but reset if you skip one
rewards: Up to 5 Skill Points for 3M stash value
Evolved Patchwork outfit with new customization
raiderImpact: Solo: Grind to 3M is achievable solo but tight on time, start stacking now
Duo: Split loot routes to hit stash value faster
Trio: Most efficient for speed-running the coin requirement before March 1

title: Shrouded Sky Update
teaser: Wind conditions incoming. New ARC threats spotted on the perimeter. Topside is about to get a lot less predictable.
summary: Shrouded Sky is the second major Escalation update. It introduces a new gusty wind map condition affecting visibility and movement, a new ARC enemy type, a new Raider Deck with cosmetics and Raider Tokens, and at least one existing map receiving a significant update.
howItWorks: New gusty wind map condition reduces visibility and affects movement
New ARC enemy type being introduced
New Raider Deck with gadgets, cosmetics, and Raider Tokens
At least one existing map receives a gameplay-affecting update
Second Expedition window opens for sign-ups
raiderImpact: Solo: Wind conditions make solo navigation harder, plan routes carefully
Duo: One spots through the wind while the other moves, strong synergy
Trio: New enemy likely requires coordinated fire, trio recommended

title: Shared Watch Event
teaser: For two weeks, raiders point barrels at machines instead of each other. Merits flow for those who cooperate.
summary: The Shared Watch is a PvE-focused live event celebrating cooperation against the ARC. Players earn Merits by destroying, assisting, and damaging ARC machines. No Merits are earned from PvP encounters during this window. Bring a friend or bring a stranger, but bring enough ammo.
howItWorks: Earn Merits from destroying, assisting, and damaging ARC machines
No Merits earned from PvP kills during the event window
Bring a squad or matchmake with strangers
Merit thresholds unlock tiered event rewards
rewards: Tiered Shared Watch event rewards based on Merit thresholds
Event-specific loot tied to PvE performance
raiderImpact: Solo: Viable, focus on ARC farming in less contested zones
Duo: Strong PvE output, can cover more ground
Trio: Maximum Merit generation, ideal for hitting top reward tiers

title: Cold Snap Returns
teaser: Winter is not done with the Rust Belt. Frostbite will end your run if you do not find shelter, but the loot is worth the risk.
summary: The Cold Snap map condition is back in rotation on outdoor maps. Frostbite damage will cut your topside trip short if you do not seek shelter, but braving the tundra means increased loot value. Candleberries are collectible but no longer event-tied. Snowballs are throwable.
howItWorks: Cold Snap active on outdoor maps in current rotation
Frostbite deals damage over time if you stay exposed
Seek shelter periodically to reset frostbite buildup
Increased loot value in Cold Snap zones as risk reward
Candleberries collectible, snowballs throwable
rewards: Increased loot value on Cold Snap maps
raiderImpact: Solo: Dangerous, frostbite management is harder without a squad watching timers
Duo: One watches exposure while the other loots
Trio: Can rotate shelter duty and maximize extraction hauls

title: February Update 1.15.0
teaser: New patch dropped. Fixes, balance passes, and two new cosmetic sets for those who like looking good while getting shot at.
summary: The February Update brings the Shared Watch event, Cold Snap return, two new cosmetic sets (Vulpine and Slugger), and a round of bug fixes and balance changes. Trailblazer Grenade no longer deals damage through walls. Several known issues remain under investigation.
howItWorks: Shared Watch event and Cold Snap map condition now active
Vulpine and Slugger cosmetic sets available
Trailblazer Grenade explosion no longer pierces walls
Reconnection improvements after disconnects
Trials objective reward timeout fix applied
raiderImpact: Solo: Trailblazer nerf affects grenade-dependent solo builds
Duo: Reconnection fix means fewer lost runs to disconnects
Trio: Trials reward fix means earned rewards actually grant properly

title: Headwinds Update
teaser: The ice melted. The survivors thawed. Solo vs Squads is live and the Trophy Display gives hunters something to mount.
summary: Headwinds was the first Escalation update. It introduced Solo vs Squads matchmaking for level 40+ Raiders, the Trophy Display player project for ARC hunting, a new map condition, and two new cosmetic sets. Extra XP is awarded for entering squad lobbies as a solo.
howItWorks: Solo vs Squads matchmaking unlocked at level 40+
Extra XP bonus for solo players entering squad lobbies
Trophy Display project: hunt ARC for sport, mount trophies
New map condition introduced
Two new cosmetic sets released
raiderImpact: Solo: Built for you, Solo vs Squads is the headline feature
Duo: Not directly affected, but Trophy Display is fun co-op content
Trio: Standard squad play unchanged

title: Escalation Season Roadmap
teaser: Four months. Four major updates. The Rust Belt is getting worse before it gets better.
summary: The Escalation season runs January through April 2026 with four major content drops: Headwinds (Jan), Shrouded Sky (Feb), Flashpoint (Mar), and Riven Tides (Apr). Each update brings new enemies, map conditions, and gear. Monthly content cadence confirmed by Embark Studios.
howItWorks: Headwinds (January): Solo vs Squads matchmaking for level 40+, Trophy Display project, new map condition
Shrouded Sky (February): New gusty wind map condition, new ARC enemy type, new Raider Deck
Flashpoint (March): Lightning hazards, additional enemies, Scrappy companion improvements
Riven Tides (April): New or heavily updated map, new high-level ARC boss
rewards: New cosmetic sets with each update
raiderImpact: Solo: Headwinds Solo vs Squads mode is built for you
Duo: Solid through all four updates
Trio: Riven Tides boss content likely tuned for full squads

title: Shrouded Sky Drop Date
teaser: Community is split on when the wind picks up. Some say the 10th, others the 17th. Nothing from Embark yet.
summary: The ARC Raiders community is actively speculating on the exact release date for the Shrouded Sky update. Reddit threads show most players expecting a mid-to-late February drop, with February 17 being the most common prediction. Embark has not confirmed a specific date beyond February.
howItWorks: Embark confirmed Shrouded Sky for February but no exact date
Community consensus leans toward February 17 based on past update cadence
Previous updates dropped on Mondays and Tuesdays
Some datamine activity suggests content is already staged
raiderImpact: Solo: Use the wait to stack coins for Expedition 2
Duo: Farm Cold Snap while it lasts
Trio: Finish Shared Watch Merit grind before rotation changes

title: Escalation Endgame
teaser: The roadmap says the scale of the impending escalation remains unknown. Shani is worried. That should worry you.
summary: Official roadmap language hints at a larger narrative event building across the Escalation season. Embark wrote that no one holds all the pieces and the scale remains unknown. Community theorists believe the four monthly updates are building toward a major ARC incursion event in April, possibly tied to Riven Tides.
howItWorks: Roadmap references an impending escalation with unknown scale
Each monthly update appears to increase ARC threat level
Shani character mentioned as being troubled by increased ARC presence
Possible culmination event during or after Riven Tides
raiderImpact: Solo: Keep leveling, whatever is coming will test you
Duo: Build synergy now for what may be endgame content
Trio: If a major incursion event drops, full squads will be essential
